bill_title: to authorize the transfer of certain landowner preference big game licenses.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to authorize the transfer of certain landowner preference big game licenses. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. The provisions of § 41-6-71 notwithstanding, any license for the hunting of east river deer, west river deer, or antelope issued to a person eighteen years of age or older on the basis of landowner preference pursuant to § 41-6-21 or as a limited license pursuant to § 41-6- 19.3 may be transferred, with or without payment or consideration, to any resident or nonresident who is qualified to apply for hunting privileges in South Dakota. However, no such license may be transferred unless the transferor owns or operates at least six hundred forty acres of agricultural, grazing, or timber land; and no additional licenses may be transferred by joint owners or operators unless each such license represents an additional six hundred forty acres jointly owned or operated. Section 2. The Game, Fish, and Parks Commission shall promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 to establish a written form and record keeping procedures for the transfer of licenses pursuant to section 1 of this Act. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.015 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to authorize the transfer of certain landowner preference big game licenses. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. The provisions of § 41-6-71 notwithstanding, any license for the hunting of east river deer, west river deer, or antelope issued to a person eighteen years of age or older as a limited license pursuant to § 41-6-19.3 may be transferred, with or without payment or consideration, to any resident or nonresident who is qualified to apply for hunting privileges in South Dakota. However, no such license may be transferred unless the transferor owns or operates at least six hundred forty acres of agricultural, grazing, or timber land. Section 2. The Game, Fish, and Parks Commission shall promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 to establish a written form and record keeping procedures for the transfer of licenses pursuant to section 1 of this Act. BILL HISTORY 1/28/97 First read in House and referred to State Affairs. H.J. 171 2/5/97 Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date. 2/5/97 State Affairs Do Pass Amended, AYES 7, NAYS 6. H.J. 315
